text: Wally Brown, CBE DL was Principal of Liverpool Community College from its creation in 1992 until his retirement in 2008.Learning and Skills Improvement Service, "LSIS Board". Retrieved 12 July 2011.Liverpool Echo "Community leader steps down" Retrieved 13 July 2011TES "Venerated college leader steps down" Retrieved 13 July 2011 Born in Toxteth, Liverpool, Brown was previously Head of Community Education in Lambeth, and an adult education manager in Manchester. At the time of the Toxteth riots, in 1981, Brown was living locally, was Chair of the Community Relations Council, and acted as a mediator between the police and the local community.BBC Motion Gallery "Wally Brown, 1981" Retrieved 13 July 2011BBC News "Toxteth riots remembered" Retrieved 13 July 2011 Brown was appointed CBE in 2001. In 2012, he was made a Freeman of the City of Liverpool for his services to education in the city and in 2014 he was made an Honorary Doctor of Education by Edge Hill University.Edge Hill University News "Liverpool community leader receives honorary doctorate" Retrieved 11 August 2016 In 2015 he was appointed a Deputy Lieutenant of Merseyside.The Merseyside Lieutenancy "New Deputy Lieutenants commissioned" Retrieved 11 August 2016 ==References== Category:English educators Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:Deputy Lieutenants of Merseyside Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:Women academic administrators Category:British academic administrators Category:People from Toxteth
